actor_awards.notes: Best known for taking over the role of Charlie Chan after the death of Warner Oland, starring in 22 films as the detective. Before films, he was a successful playwright and stage actor.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan in Honolulu
filmography.role_description: Toler's debut as the famous detective, investigating a murder on a freighter while awaiting the birth of his grandchild.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan must solve a murder on board a ship docked in Honolulu while his daughter tries to keep the news of his first grandchild a secret.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan at Treasure Island
filmography.role_description: Chan faces off against a fraudulent psychic named Dr. Zodiac at the San Francisco World's Fair.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan investigates the death of a friend on the flight to San Francisco and uncovers a fake psychic racket.

filmography.title: Our Relations
filmography.role_description: The exasperated ship captain involved in the mix-up between Laurel and Hardy and their twin brothers.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie are entrusted with a valuable ring, but things get complicated when their identical twin sailors arrive in town.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan at the Wax Museum
filmography.role_description: Chan participates in a radio broadcast at a wax museum where a fugitive gangster is hiding.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan visits a wax museum run by a plastic surgeon, where a convicted killer has taken refuge.

filmography.title: Blonde Venus
filmography.role_description: A police detective who tracks down Marlene Dietrich's character.
filmography.plot: A cabaret singer becomes the mistress of a wealthy man to pay for her husband's medical treatment, then flees with her son when her husband finds out.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Call of the Wild
filmography.role_description: A prospector in the Yukon who interacts with Clark Gable's character.
filmography.plot: A prospector heads to the Yukon during the Gold Rush and befriends a wild dog named Buck.

filmography.title: Castle in the Desert
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates a murder at an isolated castle owned by an eccentric recluse. The last of the Fox-produced Chan films.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan is invited to a castle in the Mojave Desert, where he uncovers a murder mystery involving poison.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan in City in Darkness
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates a murder in Paris during a blackout on the eve of World War II.
filmography.plot: While in Paris for a reunion, Charlie Chan investigates the murder of a munitions manufacturer during a blackout.

filmography.title: Tom Sawyer, Detective
filmography.role_description: Tom Sawyer's uncle who is accused of murder, prompting Tom to investigate.
filmography.plot: Tom Sawyer and Huckleberry Finn help clear Uncle Silas of a murder charge.

filmography.title: Double Wedding
filmography.role_description: A landlord character in this screwball comedy starring William Powell and Myrna Loy.
filmography.plot: A bohemian artist clashes with a controlling dress shop owner over her younger sister's romance, eventually falling for her himself.

filmography.title: Dead Men Tell
filmography.role_description: Chan hunts for pirate treasure and a killer on a ship.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan is hired to find a centuries-old treasure map, but the mission turns deadly when a murder occurs on the ship.

filmography.title: Murder Over New York
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates the murder of a British intelligence officer and uncovers a spy ring.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan travels to New York for a police convention and ends up solving the murder of a friend who was tracking a sabotage ring.

filmography.title: If I Were King
filmography.role_description: A character in the court of Louis XI in this historical drama.
filmography.plot: A poet boasts that he could rule France better than the King, and the King decides to let him try for a week.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination - Best Supporting Actor (Basil Rathbone)

filmography.title: The Scarlet Clue
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates a government radar theft and a series of murders in a radio station.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan discovers a spy ring stealing radar secrets while investigating a murder at a radio station.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan in Panama
filmography.role_description: Chan goes undercover to stop a saboteur known as 'Reinner' from destroying the Panama Canal.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan poses as a hat shop owner in Panama to uncover a plot to blow up the canal.

filmography.title: The Gorgeous Hussy
filmography.role_description: Toler portrays the famous American orator and politician.
filmography.plot: The story of Peggy O'Neal, the daughter of an innkeeper who charms President Andrew Jackson and disrupts Washington society.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination - Best Supporting Actress (Beulah Bondi)

filmography.title: Charlie Chan in Rio
filmography.role_description: Chan and his son arrive in Rio de Janeiro to arrest a murderess, only to find she has been murdered herself.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan and his son Jimmy travel to Rio to arrest a woman for murder, but she is killed before they can take her into custody.

filmography.title: Dark Alibi
filmography.role_description: Chan races against time to save a man wrongly convicted of bank robbery from execution.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan investigates a case where an innocent man is framed for bank robbery and murder due to forged fingerprints.

filmography.title: Gold Is Where You Find It
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this Michael Curtiz film about the conflict between gold miners and farmers.
filmography.plot: A bitter feud erupts between hydraulic gold miners and wheat farmers in 1870s California.

filmography.title: The Chinese Cat
filmography.role_description: Chan solves a locked-room murder mystery involving a cat and precious diamonds.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan comes out of retirement to solve a murder case involving a diamond smuggling ring and a mysterious cat statue.

filmography.title: Spitfire
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this Katharine Hepburn drama.
filmography.plot: A mountain girl who believes she has healing powers is driven from her home by superstitious neighbors.

filmography.title: Dangerous Money
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates a murder on a cruise ship bound for Samoa involving stolen currency.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan investigates the murder of a treasury agent on a ship to Samoa and uncovers a currency and art smuggling ring.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan in Reno
filmography.role_description: Chan travels to Reno to clear a woman accused of murdering her husband's mistress.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan goes to Reno to help a friend who has been arrested for the murder of the woman her husband was planning to marry.

filmography.title: The Shanghai Cobra
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates murders by snake bite linked to a stolen supply of radium.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan investigates a series of murders involving cobra venom, which are linked to a bank robbery in Shanghai.

filmography.title: The Trap
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates the murders of showgirls in Malibu. Toler's final film appearance.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan investigates the murders of showgirls at a Malibu beach house, trying to find a missing girl before she becomes the next victim.
